questions.text: A 6-year-old girl underwent an ultrasonography for recurring abdominal pain. The scan revealed a horse-shoe kidney without any other abnormalities. The stool examination revealed Giardia. The girl was given Anti-Giardial medication and she responded to the treatment. Which statement regarding her horse-shoe kidney is true?

options.label: A
options.text: The most common fusion is at the upper pole.

options.label: B
options.text: Urgent CT urography with angiography to ascertain the vascularity at the fusion to aid in the separation of both the kidneys

options.label: C
options.text: No treatment needed for horse-shoe kidney

options.label: D
options.text: Diagnostic laparoscopy is key in the further treatment of the girl

questions.correct_answer: C. No treatment needed for horse-shoe kidney

questions.text: A 7 -year-old girl has been brought to the OPD with complaints of urinary incontinence. Parents have also confirmed that the girl has normal voiding as well and the incontinence is all round the day. Ultrasound revealed duplication of the left renal pelvis and the ureter. All except one of the following statements is true

options.label: A
options.text: IVP is better than CECT

options.label: B
options.text: Urine routine and culture should be done

options.label: C
options.text: Cystoscopy should be part of the treatment armamentarium

options.label: D
options.text: Radio-isotope scan is necessary for the treatment

questions.correct_answer: A. IVP is better than CECT

questions.text: A 30-year-old man had a severe abdominal colic for which he underwent USG which revealed a 1cm calculus in the upper ureter (left side) with proximal hydro-ureteronephrosis. All of the following statements are false except

options.label: A
options.text: ESWL is better than PCNL in this case

options.label: B
options.text: PCNL is preferred over ESWL

options.label: C
options.text: Ureteroscopic pushing of the stone back to pelvis followed by ESWL

options.label: D
options.text: Tamsulousine alongwith hydrotherapy should be the first line treatment

questions.correct_answer: C. Ureteroscopic pushing of the stone back to pelvis followed by ESWL

questions.text: A 5-month old girl had lump abdomen for which an ultrasound was done which revealed enlarged left kidney with multiple cysts. The right kidney was normal. Which of the following statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: CT brain is important as the girl can have berry aneurysms

options.label: B
options.text: CECT abdomen is indicated

options.label: C
options.text: The girl can also have cysts in liver and her ovaries

options.label: D
options.text: Conservative treatment till second decade of life

questions.correct_answer: B. CECT abdomen is indicated

questions.text: Identify the following instrument

options.label: A
options.text: Forgarty catheter

options.label: B
options.text: LASER probe

options.label: C
options.text: Resectoscope

options.label: D
options.text: Dormia basket

questions.correct_answer: D. Dormia basket

questions.text: The IVP of the 12-year-old boy is being shown here. What is the best treatment for this boy knowing that his major problem is pain right upper abdomen.

options.label: A
options.text: Conservative

options.label: B
options.text: Cystolithotomy

options.label: C
options.text: Right partial nephrectomy

options.label: D
options.text: Left ureteric reimplantation

questions.correct_answer: C. Right partial nephrectomy

questions.text: One of the statements regarding renal calculi is false

options.label: A
options.text: Secondary Hyper-parathyroidism is one of the important causes of renal calculi

options.label: B
options.text: Calcium oxalate stones are more symptomatic than Staghorn calculus

options.label: C
options.text: Renal pelvic stones may be the intra-mural cause of hydronephrosis

questions.text: Identify the location of the ureteric stone in which patient is experiencing severe stabbing pain at the terminal part of the micturition with straining and hematuria.

options.label: A
options.text: Pelvic brim

options.label: B
options.text: PUJ/ upper ureter

options.label: C
options.text: Interstitial part of ureter

options.label: D
options.text: At the crossing of Iliacs

questions.correct_answer: C. Interstitial part of ureter

questions.text: A 30-year-old man presented with high grade fever with right flank vague tender lump. The right renal angle has bulge and is also tender. Ultrasonography done reveals right renal pelvic stone of size 3 cm with moderate hydronephrosis with septated internal echoes. Which statement out of the following is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Urgent open pyelolithotomy under antibiotic cover should be done

options.label: B
options.text: Urgent PCNL under antibiotic cover is preferred treatment

options.label: C
options.text: Antibiotics with DJ stent placement cystoscopically is preferred

options.label: D
options.text: Polycythemia is an unusual finding in this disease due to Eryhtropoetin release

questions.correct_answer: C. Antibiotics with DJ stent placement cystoscopically is preferred

questions.text: A 65-year-old man had hematuria for two days. The urine was negative for NMP22 and ultrasound revealed a left renal mass at the upper pole of left kidney measuring 5 cm, with thrombus in Left renal vein extending to the IVC. One of the following statements regarding the management of the above case is false?

options.label: A
options.text: NMP22 is a very sensitive tumor marker for Hypernephroma

options.label: B
options.text: CECT abdomen and the chest should be performed at the same sitting

options.label: C
options.text: Bone scans should be routinely performed before surgery

options.label: D
options.text: IVC thrombus is not a contraindication for surgery

questions.correct_answer: A. NMP22 is a very sensitive tumor marker for Hypernephroma

questions.text: The most variant of RCC is

options.label: A
options.text: Papillary

options.label: B
options.text: Chromophobe

options.label: C
options.text: Grawitz tumor

options.label: D
options.text: Clear cell sarcoma

questions.correct_answer: C. Grawitz tumor

questions.text: All of the following statements regarding radical nephrectomy are true except

options.label: A
options.text: Ureters are ligated as far of possible from the kidney

options.label: B
options.text: Renal vein is ligated before renal artery

options.label: C
options.text: Lymph node dissection is must

options.label: D
options.text: Adrenals are not resected routinely

questions.correct_answer: B. Renal vein is ligated before renal artery

questions.text: A 8-year-old child with a known case of lumbar myelocele operated in infancy, has fecal and urinary incontinence. Ultrasound confirmed bilateral hydro-ureteronephrosis and a small capacity bladder. Which of the following statements regarding the management is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Cystoscopy should be the first line treatment

options.label: B
options.text: Bladder – pressure studies is important before planning management

options.label: C
options.text: MRI lumbo-sacral spine is not indicated

options.label: D
options.text: MACE surgery may help in urinary incontinence

questions.correct_answer: B. Bladder – pressure studies is important before planning management

questions.text: All of the following statements regarding augmentation are false except one

options.label: A
options.text: The principle of augmentation is to convert low capacity and low pressure bladder to large capacity high pressure system

options.label: B
options.text: One of the metabolic complications of augmentation is Hypochloremic metabolic acidosis

options.label: C
options.text: Post augmentation patient needs to be on regular bladder washes to avoid stone formation

options.label: D
options.text: The bladder has a higher incidence of squamous cell carcinoma

questions.correct_answer: C. Post augmentation patient needs to be on regular bladder washes to avoid stone formation

questions.text: A 75-year-old man has painless hematuria for 1 day. He reported to the emergency of your hospital for treatment. He was started on IV fluids and vitals recorded BP was 150/90, Pulse is 120 / min. The next logical investigation for this patient is

questions.text: All of the following statements about BPH are correct except one

options.label: A
options.text: Hypertrophy of prostate involves the gland

options.label: B
options.text: The irritative symptoms in bladder outlet obstruction is due to the detrusor hypertrophy and contributes to failure of treatment.

options.label: C

questions.text: A 60-year-old man comes to the OPD with the complaints of decreased stream of urine and intermittent stream. On enquiring he also said that he passes urine 5 times at night and had one episode of hematuria one week back. On examination his Pulse was 80 / min and BP was 170/100. His per abdomen examination was unremarkable and he refused consent for per rectal examination. The blood parameters were Hemoglobin 7.8 g/dl and TLC was 21,000. Blood urea was 70 mg/dl and Serum creatinine 2.2. Blood sugar fasting was 210.Which statement in his management is true?

options.label: A
options.text: He should undergo urgent TURP

options.label: B
options.text: TRUS in this patient is preferred for the diagnosis

options.label: C
options.text: Patient should be catheterized

options.label: D
options.text: Patient needs a Urodynamic study under antibiotic coverage

questions.correct_answer: C. Patient should be catheterized

questions.text: Which statement regarding management of BPH is false

options.label: A
options.text: TURP is performed by an instrument called Resectoscope

options.label: B
options.text: TURP should be performed after one year of medical management in case of acute retention of urine

options.label: C
options.text: Distilled water should not be used as an irrigant

questions.text: A 55-year-old man underwent TURP for BPH and soon after surgery he developed urinary incontinence. Which statement about his further course of management is true?

options.label: A
options.text: He should be started on alfa 1a blockers

options.label: B
options.text: Pelvis exercises are the best approach for this patient

options.text: He should undergo a urodynamic study

questions.text: A 70-year-old man underwent TURP for BPH and biopsy showed Stage 1a adenocarcinoma prostate. What should be the next line of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Open radical prostatectomy

options.label: B
options.text: DRE and PSA 3 monthly

options.label: C
options.text: Robotic prostatectomy

options.label: D
options.text: Bilateral orchidectomy and androgen receptor block

questions.correct_answer: B. DRE and PSA 3 monthly

questions.text: A 15 month old boy was brought by her parents for absent testis in the right scrotum. On examining the child the testis was located in the inguinal canal. Which statement out of the following is true

options.label: A
options.text: The child should undergo an early surgery to prevent complication like Seminoma testis

options.label: B
options.text: USG should be done to confirm and differentiate testis from lymph nodes

options.label: C
options.text: There is no role of hormonal study in this boy

options.label: D
options.text: Laparoscopy assisted orchidopexy gives the best results

questions.correct_answer: C. There is no role of hormonal study in this boy

questions.text: A 5-year-old boy was brought to the OPD with complaints of absent test in both the scrotum. On examination left testis was not palpable and the right testis was palpable in the right inguinal canal. Which statement out of the following in the management of the child is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Doppler USG to trace the left testis

options.label: B
options.text: Bilateral inguinal exploration followed by bilateral orchidopexy is the best management

options.label: C
options.text: Diagnostic laparoscopy and right orchidopexy gives the best outcome

options.label: D
options.text: Serum FSH, LH and Testosterone is helpful in bilateral undescended testis

questions.correct_answer: C. Diagnostic laparoscopy and right orchidopexy gives the best outcome

questions.text: A 30 – year man comes with history of trauma to the scrotum 1 month back followed by a lump in the right scrotum. Which statement regarding the further management is true?

options.label: A

questions.text: A boy was born through normal vaginal delivery, with antenatally diagnosed bilateral hydronephrosis. Post natal period an USG confirmed bilateral hydronephrosis with thick walled bladder. Which statement regarding the disease of the boy is false?
